item.title: Builders waste pile getting bigger, 28th August
item.description:
The builders waste is next to a grey building near the railway bridge in Rockingham street,this pile is growing and a couple of times I have pasted it I can hear the rubble shifting which is worrying as the schools go back soon and lots of small children are being taken to school pass this rubble.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Falmouth Road, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubnish, 28th August
item.description:
The whole area of the T Green and leading into the woods is disgusting, clothing and rubbish everywhere left by tough sleepers and druggies. The bins are never emptied either, the plants are overgrown the area has never been this bad, it is constantly complained about and nothing is being cleaned up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rutherglen Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Station Approach, Marylebone Road, Marylebone, London

item.title: Fly tipped rubbish bags that smell, 28th August
item.description:
